definition: to idle/to waste time
confused/dirty/to mix/muddy/variant of 渾|浑[hun2]
to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The teacher told the students not to dawdle away their time.
sentences.chinese: 老師告訴學生們別混日子。

sentences.english: The stupid and the timeservers were lucky.
sentences.chinese: 那些蠢人和混日子的人會幸運一些。

sentences.english: They do not study technology, elaborate business, go late to dawdle.
sentences.chinese: 他們不鑽研技術，不精心業務，晚來早走混日子。

sentences.english: We muddle along from day to day.
He is mucking about every day.
You'd better not to muck about any more. You're old enough to get a job.
sentences.chinese: 你別再混日子啦，像你這歲數早該找個活兒幹了。

sentences.english: Of course, if be the practice of dawdle , that can do a person that copy only.
sentences.chinese: 當然，如果是混日子的做法，那就只能做個拷貝者。

sentences.english: He does nothing, just drifts along.
sentences.chinese: 他無所事事，只是混日子。

sentences.english: Lots of people get by on significantly less sleep, but this has its trade-offs.
sentences.chinese: 很多人用少睡覺來混日子，不過這事有取有舍。

sentences.english: Libra, you are not content to just laze around a secluded villa.
sentences.chinese: 秤子可不會滿足於僅在偏遠的別墅裏混日子。

sentences.english: It's an easy way to get by when you don't have a long-term plan.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有長遠計劃的時候，很容易混日子。

sentences.english: It is almost one year that I have been in USA.
sentences.chinese: 來美國快一年了，沒有讀書，只是在老哥這裏混日子。

definition: to muddle along/to live aimlessly
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: see 做一天和尚撞一天鐘|做一天和尚撞一天钟[zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1]
pinyin: dang1 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1

definition: to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
ordinary/mediocre
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
to idle about
muddleheaded
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
unemployed person/vagrant/rogue
to waste time on worthless activities
unaccomplished/mediocre/feckless
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
lit. just sitting and eating, one can deplete even a mountain of wealth (idiom)/fig. to spend one's money without generating any income
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
